title: ARCGraph.fromCvParamListAsNodes
content:
ARCGraph.fromCvParamListAsNodes 
fromCvParamListAsNodes 
 Takes a list of CvParams and returns the ArcGraph as an FGraph consisting of Nodes only.

title: ARCGraph.getRelatedIParamsBy
content:
ARCGraph.getRelatedIParamsBy 
getRelatedIParamsBy 
 Returns all terms (as ID * OboTerm * ArcRelation) of a given CvParam by using a given ontology graph via a given relating function.

title: ARCGraph.getRelatedIParams
content:
ARCGraph.getRelatedIParams 
getRelatedIParams 
 Returns all related terms (as ID * OboTerm * ArcRelation) of a given CvParam by using a given ontology graph.

title: ARCGraph.getSucceedingCvParams
content:
ARCGraph.getSucceedingCvParams 
getSucceedingCvParams 
 Returns all succeeding terms (as ID * OboTerm * ArcRelation) of a given CvParam by using a given ontology graph.

title: ARCGraph.getPrecedingCvParams
content:
ARCGraph.getPrecedingCvParams 
getPrecedingCvParams 
 Returns all preceding terms (as ID * OboTerm * ArcRelation) of a given CvParam by using a given ontology graph.

title: ARCGraph.hasRelationTo
content:
ARCGraph.hasRelationTo 
hasRelationTo 
 Checks is a given current CvParam has a given ArcRelation to a given prior CvParam by using a given ontology graph.

title: ARCGraph.hasFollowsTo
content:
ARCGraph.hasFollowsTo 
hasFollowsTo 
 Checks is a given current CvParam has a follows relationship to a given prior CvParam by using a given ontology graph.

title: ARCGraph.hasPartOfTo
content:
ARCGraph.hasPartOfTo 
hasPartOfTo 
 Checks is a given current CvParam has a part_of relationship to a given prior CvParam by using a given OboOntology.

title: ARCGraph.getMissingTerms
content:
ARCGraph.getMissingTerms 
getMissingTerms 
 Returns all terms that are present in the given ontology but don't occur in the given CvParam list as CvParams.

title: ARCGraph.addMissingTerms
content:
ARCGraph.addMissingTerms 
addMissingTerms 
 Takes an OboOntology and a list of IParams and returns the list with all OboTerms that are missing in the list appended as empty-value IParams.

title: ARCGraph.groupTerms
content:
ARCGraph.groupTerms 
groupTerms 
 Groups the given IParams by their name and groups them together.

title: ARCGraph.isHeader
content:
ARCGraph.isHeader 
isHeader 
 Checks if a given IParam is a header term in a given OboOntology.

title: ARCGraph.addMissingTermsInGroup
content:
ARCGraph.addMissingTermsInGroup 
addMissingTermsInGroup 
 Checks if there are missing terms in a given seq of IParams by using a given ontology-based FGraph and adds them if so. A term is defined as missing if it has a part_of relation to the seq's head term and is not present in the seq's tail.

title: ARCGraph.isPartOfHeader
content:
ARCGraph.isPartOfHeader 
isPartOfHeader 
 Checks if a given IParam has a part_of relation to a given header term using an ontology-based FGraph.

title: ARCGraph.isObsoleteTerm
content:
ARCGraph.isObsoleteTerm 
isObsoleteTerm 
 Checks if the given IParam contains an obsolete term using a given OboOntology.

title: ARCGraph.deconstructTf
content:
ARCGraph.deconstructTf 
deconstructTf 
 Returns the TermFamiliarity's IParam value.

title: ARCGraph.matchTerms
content:
ARCGraph.matchTerms 
matchTerms 
 Takes a seq of grouped IParams and tags them according to their TermFamiliarity using a given OboOntology.

title: ARCGraph.constructIntermediateMetadataSubgraph
content:
ARCGraph.constructIntermediateMetadataSubgraph 
constructIntermediateMetadataSubgraph 
 Takes an ontology-based FGraph and a seq of termname * matched IParams to create an intermediate subgraph out of it. This subgraph consists of a chain of nodes that have their termname as nodekey and their IParam seq as nodedata. The nodes are ordered by the follows-relationship taken from the ontology-based FGraph.

title: ARCGraph.addEmptyIpsToNodeData
content:
ARCGraph.addEmptyIpsToNodeData 
addEmptyIpsToNodeData 
 Takes a subgraph and adds empty IParams of the respective CvTerm to the nodedata if it is shorter than the longest IParam seq of any nodedata so that all IParam seqs have the same amount of items. Ignores the header.

title: ARCGraph.splitMetadataSubgraph
content:
ARCGraph.splitMetadataSubgraph 
splitMetadataSubgraph 
 Splits the nodedata of a given intermediate subgraph into single nodes. Nodekey changes from name to name * number (of occurence), 0-based.

title: ARCGraph.metadataSubgraphToList
content:
ARCGraph.metadataSubgraphToList 
metadataSubgraphToList 
 Takes a metadata subgraph and returns its content as a list of flat list in the form of (name * number) * nodedata. The inner list has their items grouped by the number.

title: ARCGraph.fillTokenList
content:
ARCGraph.fillTokenList 
fillTokenList 
 Takes a structural ontology and a seq of IParams, fills in all missing IParams, and returns the IParam seq but grouped by term name (most inner seq) and divided into sections (middle seq).

title: TermFamiliarity
content:
TermFamiliarity 
 Representation of the familiarity of a CvParam's CvTerm. If the CvTerm is known in, e.g., an ontology, use KnownTerm, else use UnknownTerm. ObsoleteTerm is for deprecated terms (i.e., OboTerm with `is_obsolete` = `true`). 
TermFamiliarity.KnownTerm 
KnownTerm 
TermFamiliarity.UnknownTerm 
UnknownTerm 
TermFamiliarity.ObsoleteTerm 
ObsoleteTerm 
TermFamiliarity.MisplacedTerm 
MisplacedTerm

title: OboGraph.tryToARCRelation
content:
OboGraph.tryToARCRelation 
tryToARCRelation 
 Takes a TermRelation of string and returns the approbriate ARCRelation plus source term and target term as a triple. If the TermRelation is Empty or TargetMissing, returns None.

title: OboGraph.ontologyToFGraph
content:
OboGraph.ontologyToFGraph 
ontologyToFGraph 
 Takes an OboOntology and returns an FGraph with OboTerms as nodes (with their ID as nodekey) and ARCRelations as Edges. The structure of the graph results from the TermRelations between the ontology's terms.

title: OboGraph.ontologyToFGraphByName
content:
OboGraph.ontologyToFGraphByName 
ontologyToFGraphByName 
 Takes an OboOntology and returns an FGraph with OboTerms as nodes (with their name as nodekey) and ARCRelations as Edges. The structure of the graph results from the TermRelations between the ontology's terms.

title: Orcid
content:
Orcid 
 Functions to work with ORCID numbers. 
Orcid.checksum 
checksum 
Orcid.checkRange 
checkRange 
Orcid.checkValid 
checkValid

title: Orcid.checksum
content:
Orcid.checksum 
checksum 
 Calculates the checksum digit of an ORCID.
 The calculated checksum digit must match the last character of the given ORCID.
 
 Input parameter "digits" must be the full ORCID to check but already without all hyphens excluded, e.g. `1111222233334444`.

title: Orcid.checkRange
content:
Orcid.checkRange 
checkRange 
 Checks if the given ORCID digits are in range.
 Current range is 0000000150000007 to 0000000350000001 and 0009000000000000 to 0009001000000000 (as of July 2023).
 
 Input parameter "digits" must be the full ORCID to check but already without all hyphens excluded, e.g. `1111222233334444`.

title: Orcid.checkValid
content:
Orcid.checkValid 
checkValid 
 Checks if a given string is a valid ORCID.
 
 Checks if the ORCID is in current number range and has a valid checksum digit.

Param

title: Validate.email
content:
Validate.email 
email 

 Validates wether the given Param's value is an email that matches a pre-defined regex pattern ("^[^@\s]+@[^@\s]+\.[^@\s]+$") 
 and wether the param is annotated with the term `Investigation Person Email`
